Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk strongimcv
exit 0

exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: strongimcv bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated strongimcv packages that fix several bugs and add various enhancements are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The strongimcv packages provide Trusted Network Connect's (TNC) architecture support. They include support for a TNC client and server (IF-TNCCS), Integrity Measurement Collector (IMC) and Integrity Measurement Verifier (IMV) message exchange (IF-M), as well as an interface between IMC/IMV and a TNC client/server (IF-IMC and IF-IMV). They also include PTS-based IMC/IMV for TPM-based remote attestation, SWID IMC/IMV, and OS IMC/IMV.
The strongimcv packages have been upgraded to upstream version 5.2.0, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1120371)
This update also fixes the following bugs:
* Previously, the strongimcv policy script used a hard-coded name for the strongimcv executable, which did not correspond with the executable name in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. As a consequence, running the strongimcv policy manager in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 failed. This update modifies the policy script to use a flexible executable name, which prevents the described problem. (BZ#1144511)
* Due to threading incompatibility with the strongimcv OpenSSL plug-in, the wpa_supplicant program terminated unexpectedly with a segmentation fault after a TNC negotiation finished if wpa_supplicant was running along with strongimcv. With this update, the strongimcv OpenSSL plug-in has been update to be thread-compatible with wpa_supplicant, and wpa_supplicant no longer crashes after TNC negotiations. (BZ#1144524)
* Prior to this update, the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol client of strongimcv was not compatible with the 64-bit PowerPC microarchitecture. As a consequence, using the "strongimcv pt-tls-client" command on a 64-bit PowerPC machine failed. This update addresses the compatibility problems and "strongimcv pt-tls-client" now works as expected on 64-bit PowerPC machines. (BZ#1179330)
Users of strongimcv are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
